title: Congratulations Meta, you killed Threads
text: Removing the Following Feed was the most colossally stupid thing to do. Why do you think we follow accounts? So we can hunt for them in a feed you’ve decided we can see? You’re making the app unusable to the point of pointlessness with this change.

title: Great platform !!
text:
Ive been using Threads since it 1st started and the growth has been tremendous. 

I’ve enjoyed the user interface and how easy to use it is. The community that I’ve gravitated too has been NBA Threads. The discourse of fandom along with high lQ basketball convos has been awesome. 

I also love the connection with my IG account too along with networking with bigger accounts. Love it!

title: Increased eye strain
text: Be been loving this app, and the people I’ve met on it. I use it daily, and find it easy. They update regularly to add new features, and the community seems largely supportive. This last update has ruined it. It now makes my eyes strain far more than it used to, and other apps don’t have the same issue. This is a big issue, and will definitely minimize my use of the app.

title: Feeling Social
text: Threads stands out as a sanctuary for artistic souls, offering impeccable curation of diverse talents. Every scroll unveils captivating content, from intricate illustrations to breathtaking landscapes. The platform fosters a vibrant community of like-minded individuals passionate about art, fostering engaging discussions and support. With its user-friendly interface, navigating Threads is a seamless experience, integrating effortlessly into daily routines. Overall, Threads is a must-have for anyone seeking inspiration and connection in the world of creativity.

title: Arbitrary limits abound in Threads
text:
Meta in its infinite wisdom has decided that no one can follow more than 7500 accounts (which is quite low given they do not support Lists which would allow you to put accounts for your different interests in diff Lists), that users aren’t interested in following political accounts & that there is no need for usable search, help or customer support systems.

I was willing to let things slide but it’s been out a while now and it’s time they made it useful for the bigger accounts that would drive more users to it.

title: 🔟 out of 🔟
text: Threads is an wonderful app for sharing your thoughts and opinions about American culture. As the pioneers of freedom of speech, Threads allows its users to communicate with like minded individuals domestically and abroad. When considering a social media app to utilize for your daily needs, please consider using Threads.

title: Fresh social app for non-toxic conversations
text:
In my experience, Threads is a no-fuss, positive space to follow and contribute to your areas of interest. Most of the things I’ve seen have been constructive, with less toxicity than other platforms.

This could all change over time of course, but for now it’s my favorite social media app!
